p: Derivatives of flavonoids that mainly occur via migration of phenyl group from C-2 to C-3 include various compounds as isoflavones, isoflavanones, isoflavans, and isoflavones. Isoflavones were mainly found in family of leguminosae and their in vitro microbial testing showed considerable antiviral effect [ 228]. Isoflavanones differ from isoflavones only due to the presence of a chiral center; naturally obtained prenylated isoflavanones from Bolus Harms had noticeable activity against HIV [ 229]. Isoflavans belongs to the subclass of isoflavonoids without carbonyl groups at C4 carbon that also show antiviral activity.
